titles.title: Small Business Lending Incentive Program Act of 2010
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a business credit for small business loans.
Small Business Lending Incentive Program Act of 2010

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: Small Business Lending Incentive Program Act of 2010 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow certain small banks a business-related tax credit for 1% of the total amount of loans made to small business concerns. Limits the amount of any such small business loan to $500,000, and limits to 20 the number of such loans a bank may include in the calculation of its credit in any taxable year. Terminates such credit two years after the enactment of this Act.
